com.snakk.advertising
Interface SnakkInterstitialAd

public interface SnakkInterstitialAd

Interstitials are full screen ads that display in their own Activity. Interstitials are best used at discrete stopping points in your app's flow, such as at the end of a game level, or when the player dies.

Simple example:

     SnakkInterstitialAd interstitialAd = SnakkAdvertising.getInterstitialAdForZone(context, "YOUR_ZONE_ID");
     interstitialAd.show(); // interstitial is loaded and shown asynchronously
Instances of SnakkInterstitialAd are not safe for use by multiple threads.

Nested Class Summary
static interface SnakkInterstitialAd.SnakkInterstitialAdListener
          Implement this interface to be notified of interstitial ad lifecycle changes.

Method Detail

getListener

SnakkInterstitialAd.SnakkInterstitialAdListener getListener()

setListener

void setListener(SnakkInterstitialAd.SnakkInterstitialAdListener interstitialListener)
Parameters:
interstitialListener - the listener instance that will be notified of ad lifecycle events

isLoaded

boolean isLoaded()
Used to determine if interstitial is ready to be shown.

Returns:
true if ready for display, false otherwise

load

void load()
Fire off an asynchronous request to server for an interstitial ad. Use isLoaded() or SnakkInterstitialAd.SnakkInterstitialAdListener to determine when interstitial is loaded.

show

void show()
Display interstitial to user. If interstitial is not loaded, load() will be called and the interstitial will be loaded and shown asynchronously. Use isLoaded() or SnakkInterstitialAd.SnakkInterstitialAdListener to determine when interstitial is loaded.
